preqs: Students must have passed ETX2111, ETF2100, ETX2121, ETF2121, ETF9100, ETF5910, ETF9121, ETF5912, ETF9300, ETF5930, MBA9007, MBA5907 or equivalent.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETF2100, ETF2121, ETF5910, ETF5912, ETF5930, ETF9100, ETF9121, ETF9300, ETX2111, ETX2121, MBA5907, MBA9007} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

For COURSE_CODE IN {3816, 3822, 4412} Do true Otherwise Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETF2100, ETF5910, ETF5912, ETF5930, ETF9100, ETF9121, ETF9300, ETX2111, ETX2121, MBA9007} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ETC2450, ETF3231, ETX3231}

description: Forecasts are crucial for guiding the planning and decision making process in business. In this unit you will learn to apply reliable methods for generating accurate forecasts in a rapidly changing business environment. These include: an introduction to regression modelling from a forecasting perspective, classical decomposition, exponential smoothing, Box-Jenkins ARIMA modelling and judgemental forecasting. You will build your programming skills by learning to program in R, a free programming language for statistical computing.
